node.title: Controversial government tourism fund saved jobs, propped up business, recipient says
node.description: The $290m Strategic Tourism Assets Protection Programme was formed to provide rapid support for NZ's significant tourism assets, but it's come under scrutiny with concerns about transparency.

node.title: Surviving hostage testifies about ordeal in ISIS captivity
node.description: El Shafee Elsheikh, member of the ISIS group nicknamed "the Beatles," is on trial in Virginia facing hostage and terrorism charges.

node.title: Former Alaska Governor Sarah Palin announces run for Congress
node.description: Alaska will hold special election this summer to replace the House seat left vacant when Rep. Don Young died earlier this month.

node.title: Transport minister on board with Auckland’s half-price public transport
node.description: Minister of Transport Michael Wood is remaining tight-lipped on whether the government has plans to extend cut-price fares for public transport users beyond 30 June.

node.title: Bruce Willis 'worst performance' award cancelled
node.description: Razzie organisers said it was "not appropriate" after the announcement about the actor's health issues.

node.title: NIWA scientists to map Tonga eruption's impact on seabed
node.description: NIWA scientists are undertaking a mission to discover the undersea impacts of the recent Tongan volcanic eruption.

node.title: Yemen's warring parties agree two-month truce in major breakthrough
node.description: The warring sides in Yemen's seven-year conflict have for the first time in years agreed a nationwide truce, says the United Nations envoy.

node.title: Will Smith resigns from the Academy after slapping Chris Rock at Oscars
node.description: "My actions at the 94th Academy Awards presentation were shocking, painful, and inexcusable," Smith said in a statement.

node.title: 12-year-old fatally shot in New York City as violent crime spikes nationwide
node.description: Nationally, homicide rates have risen by an average of 37% in the biggest cities.

node.title: 9 more people indicted in gun trafficking case involving 3 U.S. soldiers
node.description: The three Fort Campbell-based U.S. soldiers were indicted last year.

node.title: The Cricket World Cup has been a winner
node.description: The first of three World Cups New Zealand will host over an 18 month period will come to an end this weekend as Australia play England in the final of the women's Cricket World Cup.

node.title: Man charged with murder in death of missing teen Naomi Irion
node.description: Troy Driver, 41, has also been charged with kidnapping, burglary, robbery and destroying evidence, officials said.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," April 3, 2022
node.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Fiona Hill, and more appear this Sunday on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan"

node.title: Ghislaine Maxwell will not get a new trial, judge rules
node.description: Maxwell, a British socialite, was convicted in December of helping Jeffrey Epstein​ sexually abuse several teenage girls.

node.title: Te Tairāwhiti roads to re-open after flooding
node.description: Main roads in Te Tairāwhiti are being re-opened with restrictions after being damaged by severe rain.

node.title: The new hot back-to-office perk? Pet stipends.
node.description: Companies are rolling out all kinds of new perks to get workers into the office. But what workers really want is flexibility.

node.title: Soccer star Hope Solo arrested for DWI with children in vehicle, police say
node.description: Solo was charged with impaired driving, resisting arrest and misdemeanor child abuse.

node.title: NASA starts dress-rehearsal countdown for SLS moon rocket
node.description: NASA is expected to set a launch date after evaluating the results of the countdown test.

node.title: Farmers face 'devastating' effects of consistent rain
node.description: A Wairoa farming leader says the relentless rain still falling in northern Hawke's Bay is like a recurring nightmare and farmers are beside themselves.

node.title: Calls for public transport discount to be extended
node.description: The minister of transport has hinted that the government could extend the three-month discount on public transport tickets. Audio

node.title: Man who conspired to launch viral GoFundMe scam sentenced to 27 months
node.description: The trio made up a story in late 2017 that sparked $400,000 in GoFundMe donations.

node.title: Federal Reserve issues warning of "brewing U.S. housing bubble"
node.description: Economists say the pandemic housing boom is showing "signs of exuberance" akin to the boom of the early 2000s.

node.title: Jury deliberations set to begin in Whitmer kidnap plot case
node.description: Adam Fox, Barry Croft Jr., Daniel Harris and Brandon Caserta are charged with conspiracy, and three also face weapons charges.

node.title: CDC says Title 42 expulsions of migrants are no longer needed
node.description: The CDC director cited improving pandemic conditions, including increased vaccination rates in the U.S. and migrants' home countries.

node.title: Increases to benefits, super, student allowances take effect
node.description: Despite the boosts to benefits, anti-poverty campaigners warn some of the poorest families could still be up to $300 short a week.

node.title: 'Thing of the past': Tests confirm council on track to solve dirty water problem
node.description: Napier's council hopes new bores will help solve the dirty brown water problems plaguing the city's taps.

node.title: Cockpit windshield cracks during Delta Air Lines flight
node.description: A photo of the windshield taken by a passenger showed the glass, though lined with cracks, didn't fall from its frame.

node.title: U.S. men's national soccer team learns who they will play in the World Cup
node.description: The U.S. will play England the day after Thanksgiving.

node.title: America's Cup defence in Barcelona: 'This should not have happened'
node.description: The Royal NZ Yacht Squadron has failed the country by letting the regatta go to Spain, Sir Michael Fay says. Audio

node.title: Scott Morrison says Australia will send Bushmasters to Ukraine and fill Volodymyr Zelensky's request
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says Australia will fly a number of Australian-made Bushmaster vehicles over to Ukraine, after a public plea from the nation's wartime President.
